intro: Geniostoma triflorum, commonly known as the three-flowered geniostoma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds. Geniostoma triflorum is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
